When I checked earlier today after the previous email it was updated. So this is a Shane problem, I say blame it on the Mac.

Mitch

Hi Shane,

Great question. In short, it depends on several factors at the user end, most significantly the device (smartphone or desktop) settings and how it has been set to cache the pages that are visited.

Across the board, I have only encountered one client that experienced caching taking longer than a couple of hours to update at their end. This was an iPhone of all things. 

Again, you may wish to check with Grant and Mitch to see if they are experiencing the same.

Hi Chris

Thank you - incognito works, so that is how I'll check from here on.

I guess a concern I have is, how long might it take for (returning) users coming to the site to see the updated content..

Is this standard for the other sites you manage to take a while to update? Assuming this isn't unique to us.

Regards,

Shane

The screenshot attached shows a heavily zoomed-out view in an incognito window in Chrome. Perhaps Grant and Mitch can check at their end?

Does it need to be published?

From: Richard Magallanes <richard.magallanes@prosperitymedia.com.au>
Sent: Tuesday, 7 March 2023 12:23 PM
To: Shane Hammond <shaneh@trueline.net.au>
Cc: Grant Gilroy <grantg@trueline.net.au>; Mitch Day <Mitchd@trueline.net.au>; Matt Keats <matt@prosperitymedia.com.au>; Rachel Iorfino <rachel.iorfino@prosperitymedia.com.au>
Subject: Broken Element On Website + Markup.io Tutorial
Hey guys,

I've noticed that there's a broken element on the Patios + Pergolas page:
https://trueline.net.au/patios-pergolas/



As you can see, this usually shows up as a gallery, rather than huge pictures as shown above. You can have a look at it here:
https://prnt.sc/GnrOh4vWzgur

I've made note of this on an app called Markup.io - which allows you to create comments on a live site:
https://app.markup.io/invite/accept/nPFm_nEo

We can use this tool to make comments directly onto elements on the site should something break, or not be uploaded correctly.

I've created a quick tutorial on how to use this tool here:
https://www.loom.com/share/0c98b78505384729bbbbc42aa8a31c40

Thanks!
--
Richard Magallanes
SEO Executive
Office: 1300 886 452
Website: prosperitymedia.com.au
Address: Level 1, Suite 102/83-97 Kippax St, Surry Hills NSW 2010
We love client referrals at Prosperity: be sure to share our recent case studies.
